summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 between forensic examiners coordinating the review of physical evidence in the Epstein case. The emails discuss verifying and matching evidence item numbers (1B numbers) with CART barcode stickers, specifically for items from case 50D-NY-3027571, and arranging a visit to a storage location in the Bronx to inspect the items.

persons.name: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: The primary sender/requester in the email chain, working to verify and match evidence item numbers with barcodes for the Epstein case. They are coordinating a visit to the Bronx to physically inspect evidence.

connections.person1: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: Collaborating on the evidence review process for the Epstein case, with the examiner requesting information and the colleague providing a detailed inventory list.

events.title: Planned Evidence Inspection
events.description: The NYO CART Coordinator planned to visit a storage location in the Bronx to physically inspect evidence items from the Epstein case to match 1B numbers with CART barcodes.
personsInvolved: NYO CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

locations: 26 Fed (likely referring to 26 Federal Plaza, NYC)
keyFacts: The document reveals an ongoing evidence review process for the Epstein case (50D-NY-3027571) as of October 2020, well after Epstein's death.
A detailed inventory of seized digital evidence is listed, including multiple Apple desktop computers, hard drives (Seagate), an iPhone 5, cameras, and servers.
Forensic examiners were having difficulty matching internal evidence item numbers (1B numbers) with CART barcode stickers using their digital system (Sentinel), necessitating a physical inspection.
The evidence was stored in a location in the Bronx, and access required coordination between different officials.
The correspondence is marked 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER,' indicating the sensitive nature of the evidence and the ongoing legal proceedings.
